713157f-a.text:
253-251 and 249 West 43rd Street, north side, east of Eighth Avenue, showing the Ascension Memorial Church (Protestant Episcopal) and a little house set back into the block, giving it a deep front yard.
June 10, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

The New York Times of :November 22, 1939 reports the proposed demolition of this 90 year edifice. It was formerly occupied by the Bloomingdale Methodist Episcopal Church; the present
congregation acquiring same in 1895.
